characters.currentChapter: The Adventure of the Clouded Kokoro
characters.name: Susato Mikotoba
characters.description1: A judicial assistant sent to Britain on a study tour. She's the epitome of a refined Japanese lady and a huge help to me always.

characters.currentChapter: The Adventure of the Clouded Kokoro
characters.name: Mael Stronghart
characters.description1: The Lord Chief Justice, who wields absolute authority in judicial matters, including the appointment of lawyers. He's a thoroughly intimidating man.

characters.currentChapter: The Adventure of the Clouded Kokoro
characters.name: Tobias Gregson
characters.description1: The detective inspector in charge of Scotland Yard's investigation of the case. He's stern and single-minded in his approach, and a great lover of fish and chips.

characters.currentChapter: The Adventure of the Clouded Kokoro
characters.name: Soseki Natsume
characters.description1: A scholar sent to Britain by the Japanese government to further his study of English. He's the defendant accused of attempted murder.

characters.currentChapter: The Adventure of the Clouded Kokoro
characters.name: Iris Wilson
characters.description1: An extraordinary young girl who lives with Mr Sholmes. She has a degree in medicine and is the author of a popular series of short stories.

characters.currentChapter: The Adventure of the Clouded Kokoro
characters.name: Maid → Joan Garrideb
characters.description1: A maid who works at the Garrideb household. Her main duty appears to be standing at Mr Garrideb's side pouring tea.
characters.description2: Mr Garrideb's wife, who poses as the household maid merely to keep up appearances in the neighborhood. She has a fierce temper and tends to get rather physical.
characters.description3: Mr Garrideb's wife, who poses as the household maid merely to keep up appearances in the neighborhood. She is in attendance today as a member of the jury.

characters.currentChapter: The Adventure of the Clouded Kokoro
characters.name: John Garrideb
characters.description1: A retired army man who's the landlord of the lodgings rented by the defendant, Mr Natsume. An old knee injury means he's confined to a chair most of the time.

characters.currentChapter: The Adventure of the Clouded Kokoro
characters.name: Herlock Sholmes
characters.description1: There's not a person in the world who hasn't heard of this famous 'great detective'. Not a person except me, apparently.

characters.currentChapter: The Adventure of the Clouded Kokoro
characters.name: Barok van Zieks
characters.description1: A prosecutor known as the Reaper of the Bailey, though concrete details of the man are not forthcoming.

characters.currentChapter: The Adventure of the Clouded Kokoro
characters.name: Olive Green
characters.description1: The victim of this case, who was found with a knife in her back. Luckily, the wound didn't prove fatal, but the woman remains unconscious in her hospital bed.

characters.currentChapter: The Adventure of the Clouded Kokoro
characters.name: Roly Beate
characters.description1: A devoted London bobby who witnessed the incident whilst walking down the street with his wife of a year, Patricia.

characters.currentChapter: The Adventure of the Clouded Kokoro
characters.name: Patricia Beate
characters.description1: The wife of Constable Roly Beate who is a witness to the incident. She's relatively recently married, and fiercely proud of her policeman husband.

evidences.currentChapter: The Adventure of the Clouded Kokoro
evidences.name: Armband
evidences.description1: An armband I inherited from Kazuma. It identifies the wearer as a defence lawyer throughout the Empire of Japan.

evidences.currentChapter: The Adventure of the Clouded Kokoro
evidences.name: Local Map
evidences.description1: A street map of the local area showing where the victim was found.
evidences.description2: A street map of the local area showing locations that are relevant to the case.

evidences.currentChapter: The Adventure of the Clouded Kokoro
evidences.name: Iris's Postcard
evidences.description1: A card for Inspector Gregson with a message on the back from Iris.

evidences.currentChapter: The Adventure of the Clouded Kokoro
evidences.name: Secondhand Book Receipt
evidences.description1: A receipt discovered in Mr Natsume's room for some books that he had purchased from a secondhand bookshop before the incident occurred.

evidences.currentChapter: The Adventure of the Clouded Kokoro
evidences.name: Case File
evidences.description1: A file containing an overview of the case and details about the victim. She was found with a knife in her back and is currently in hospital, yet to regain consciousness.
evidences.description2: The pavement where the victim was found lies just outside Constable Beate's beat, the border of which runs down the middle of Briar Road.

evidences.currentChapter: The Adventure of the Clouded Kokoro
evidences.name: Jackknife
evidences.description1: A large but commonplace folding knife. It was found lodged in the victim's back.

evidences.currentChapter: The Adventure of the Clouded Kokoro
evidences.name: Crime Scene Photograph
evidences.description1: A photograph of the scene taken by a policeman just after the incident occurred. A large knife can be seen thrust into the victim's back.

evidences.currentChapter: The Adventure of the Clouded Kokoro
evidences.name: Crime Scene Photograph #2
evidences.description1: A second photograph of the scene taken by a policeman just after the incident. It specifically shows the victim's hand.

evidences.currentChapter: The Adventure of the Clouded Kokoro
evidences.name: The Fourth Book
evidences.description1: A book entitled 'The Lion's Pride' discovered in the victim's hand at the scene.
evidences.description2: A book entitled 'The Lion's Pride' discovered in the victim's hand at the scene. The back cover is badly burnt. * (This update to the description is entirely optional, and can only be achieved by examining the burnt corner on the back before it is specifically pointed out in court.)
evidences.description3: A book entitled 'The Lion's Pride' that was in the victim's hand when Mrs Beate first ran over to see what had happened.

evidences.currentChapter: The Adventure of the Clouded Kokoro
evidences.name: Warrant Card
evidences.description1: A small folding wallet that identifies London bobbies and contains the rules of conduct to which they must adhere.

evidences.currentChapter: The Adventure of the Clouded Kokoro
evidences.name: Anniversary Bouquet
evidences.description1: A present for Patricia Beate from her husband, Roly. The shock of seeing the stabbed victim caused Mrs Beate to drop the rose where she stood.

evidences.currentChapter: The Adventure of the Clouded Kokoro
evidences.name: Pipe
evidences.description1: Mr Garrideb's pipe. Apparently it fell to the floor during a domestic dispute he had with his wife and broke.

evidences.currentChapter: The Adventure of the Clouded Kokoro
evidences.name: Fragment of Metal
evidences.description1: This small piece of metal looks like it might be the tip of a knife blade. It was stuck inside the bowl of Mr Garrideb's pipe.
